name: Death of the Duke of York
obverse: Bust of the Duke of York facing left.
reverse: Soldier with sword and shield in mourning. The soldier is sitting in front of weapons and flags.
reverse_inscriptions: THE WARRIOR MOURNS HIS GUARDIAN FRIEND
description: Frederick Augustus was the second son of George III. He was a soldier by profession.
Interestingly, the hint of the number '8' can be seen under the '7' on the reverse. This appears to be a fault with the die as it appears on both specimens of this medal.
